detaileddescription.para: Largest period divisor value allowed.
Largest sensor interval allowed (in seconds).
String length for representing a single sensor channel.
Flag indicating this sensor type has a series representation.
String duplication variant of bt_mesh_sensor_ch_str_real for use in logging.
The sampling function is unspecified
The presented value is an instantaneous sample.
The presented value is the arithmetic mean of multiple samples.
The presented value is the root mean square of multiple samples.
The presented value is the maximum of multiple samples.
The presented value is the minimum of multiple samples.

The presented value is the accumulated moving average value of the samples. The updating frequency of the moving average should be indicated in bt_mesh_descriptor::update_interval. The total measurement period should be indicated in bt_mesh_descriptor::period.

The presented value is a count of events in a specific measurement period. bt_mesh_descriptor::period should denote the measurement period, or left to 0 to indicate that the sample is a lifetime value.
Sensor sampling type.
Represents the sampling function used to produce the presented sensor value.
Value based delta threshold. The delta threshold values are represented as absolute value changes.
Percent based delta threshold. The delta threshold values are represented as percentages of their old value (resolution: 0.01 %).
Delta threshold type.
Normal sensor publish interval.
Fast sensor publish interval.
Sensor sampling cadence

briefdescription.para: Check if a value change breaks the delta threshold.

detaileddescription.para: Sensors should publish their value if the measured sample is outside the delta threshold compared to the previously published value. This function checks the threshold and the previously published value for this sensor, and returns whether the sensor should publish its value.

simplesect.para: Only single-channel sensors support cadence. Multi-channel sensors are always considered out of their threshold range, and will always return true from this function. Single-channel sensors that haven't been assigned a threshold will return true if the value is different.
true if the difference between the measurements exceeds the delta threshold, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the sensor type associated with the given Device Property ID.

detaileddescription.para: Only known sensor types from Sensor types will be available. Sensor types can be made known to the sensor module by enabling embed:rst:inline :kconfig:`CONFIG_BT_MESH_SENSOR_ALL_TYPES` or by referencing them in the application.

simplesect.para: The associated sensor type, or NULL if the ID is unknown.

briefdescription.para: Check whether a single channel sensor value lies within a column.

parameterdescription.para: Value to check. Only the first channel is considered.

simplesect.para: true if the value belongs in the column, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the format of the sensor column data.

simplesect.para: The sensor type's sensor column format if series access is supported. Otherwise NULL.

briefdescription.para: Get a human readable representation of a single sensor channel.

parameterdescription.para: String buffer to fill. Should be BT_MESH_SENSOR_CH_STR_LEN bytes long.

simplesect.para: Number of bytes that should have been written if str is sufficiently large.

briefdescription.para: Get a human readable representation of a single sensor channel.

simplesect.para: This function is not thread safe.
A string representing the sensor channel.
